Reviews.Title: Great smartphone overall
Reviews.Author: Shahzad Chaudhary
Reviews.Content: This is a nice phone. Seems like the best you can get anymore without being required to purchase a Data Plan with the phone. I don't need one, but I still like the idea of having a smart phone. Its capable of using Wi-Fi calling for one, which is free to use anywhere in the US. But why should I have to pay for a Data Plan for my phone when I'm going to use data services on my own Wi-Fi connection which I'm already paying for? I'd definately have bought a Samsung Galaxy if the costly Data plans weren't required with the purchase of the phone. Really $70.00 extra for 24 months? That's like paying $1640 in adition to $150 for the phone. Almost $2000 for phone? Ridiculous. This phone is $100.00 once, a big difference.

Reviews.Title: This phone stinks. I actually think the positive reviews are from guerilla marketers.
Reviews.Author: Peg Morrison
Reviews.Content: Calls are spotty, screen goes blank on text messages, and battery needs charging all the time despite low usage. The call quality is the big issue - very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Great touch screen phone for a cell phone
Reviews.Author: caller510
Reviews.Content: This is a great cell phone for those who want a cell phone and NOT a mini-computer.  I've had it six months with no complaints.  I like it for ease of visibility, easy access to features and multi-screen programming.  Visual voicemail is a big plus for me and no data package is required.  I do not use it for internet connection so I have no comparison with other touch screen phones.  For me, this is a superb phone for those who want to use a phone with all the conveniences of touchscreen.
